title: The End of the 2026 Winter Olympics in Italy
summary: The 2026 Winter Olympics in Italy are over. The games were held in two cities, Milan and Cortina d'Ampezzo, and ended with a closing ceremony in Verona. During the ceremony, the Olympic flames in both cities were put out, which means the games are finished. The International Olympic Committee president said Italy did a great job and set a high standard for future games. Italy won 30 medals, which is their best ever in the Winter Olympics. The next Winter Games will be in France in 2030, and they will also use many different places for events. The closing ceremony had music, dancing, and celebrations to honor Italy's culture.

background_read: The Olympics are big sports events held every few years, with Summer and Winter Games. Countries take turns hosting them, and athletes from around the world compete for medals. The closing ceremony is a fun event to mark the end, often with music and fireworks. Italy hosted the 2026 Winter Olympics in two cities, which is special because it spreads out the events.
